thread.title: Why This Woman Decided to “Stay Pregnant” For 5 Years (VIDEO)
thread.title_full: Why This Woman Decided to “Stay Pregnant” For 5 Years (VIDEO)

author: Alissa Kombert
title: Why This Woman Decided to “Stay Pregnant” For 5 Years (VIDEO)

organizations.name: national partnership for women and families

text:
February 1, 2017 by Alissa Kombert 0 Shares Advertisement 
Imagine being pregnant for 5 years. Crazy, right? Now imagine being pregnant for 9 months and having to go back to work right away because you can't afford not to. Even crazier, right? Credit: YouTube 
This video by the National Partnership For Women and Families brings awareness to a major issue in American society: 86% of U.S. employees don't receive paid leave when they have a baby. 
The video shows a woman named Lauren, who's "decided to stay pregnant" for 260 weeks so she can eventually afford to have her baby and accrue time off to care for her child. She plans on waiting until the 6th year to give birth. Credit: YouTube 
Obviously this is a made-up situation, but it sheds light on a real problem people in our country face. The caption on the video prompts, "Ask your members of Congress to watch the video and then stand up for a robust national paid family and medical leave program." 
Watch the video below to see Lauren's story. Advertisement
